definition: to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
fast/greedy/run rapidly
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
to distance oneself from (classical)

sentences.chinese: 反而變得急功近利，好高騖遠。

sentences.english: Right now, many commentators are urging Mr. Obama to think small.
sentences.chinese: 當前，很多評論家都在奉勸奧巴馬不要過於好高騖遠。

sentences.english: It is relatively easy to envision an outcome that results from thinking big.
sentences.chinese: 好高騖遠的人們會比較容易想到事情的結果。

sentences.english: Have ambition at everywhere and not idealistic and not practical, stand on solid ground but challenge extreme limit again.
sentences.chinese: 志在四方又不好高騖遠，腳踏實地而又挑戰極限。

sentences.english: We can't always have our head in the cloud, we need to be down-to-earth.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能總是那麼好高騖遠，我們要腳踏實地。

sentences.english: Our nature, gentle, treats people sincerely.
sentences.chinese: 此人，性格平和，不好高騖遠，待人真摯。

sentences.english: People should be down-to-earth, instead of being over-ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 做人應該腳踏實地，不要好高騖遠。

definition: Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
(to act) on one's own initiative
listener
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
ill-gotten wealth or gains
idle gossip
bottomless pit
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
